title: University of South Carolina
description: Attending the University of South Carolina is arguably the best decision of my high school career. In December 2016, I graduated USC with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Information Systems and a minor in Business Information Management. During my four and a half years here, I received experience with eight new coding languages, emulating operating systems, emulating cryptographic systems, and the exposure of an entrepreneurship mindset.

title: Center for Digital Humanities
description: The Center for Digital Humanities is responsible for administering the completion of digitalizing and preserving pre-information era artifacts. When I was hired, I was tasked to administer the development of a website that revolves around an 18th-century botanist, his diary, and the specimens he collected during his lifetime. During and after the completion of that project, my tasks included design and development of eight more projects.

title: MetLife
description: Working for MetLife was the first step into the wonders of the American corporate world. Having only worked for a localized and non-profit business, this change came with many new experiences. During my 10 weeks, I migrated a prominent application for the dental sub-business from utilizing a manual tool-stack of Ant, StarTeam, and BuildForge to a more autonomous tool-stack of Maven, BitBucket, and Bamboo.

title: Lowcountry Billing
description: Lowcountry Billing brought me into their doors with hopes of teaching how IT businesses work. Not only did I get a unique insight into constructing network infrastructure for a new office, I also managed to move their website from an image-only page to an engaging business-card website. During the website reconstruction, it was here that I felt a passion for web development.
